I have given this feedback directly to management on several occasions, but it appears to fall on deaf ears. Lastly, my supervisory experience has been inconsistent. I've had a total of 8 different supervisors throughout my short time at Seneca which has made it extremely difficult to grow a relationship with any one in particular. Tying all of these things together, this is why I question the sincerity of the Seneca values. If staff are not truly being taken care of, how is it expected that they will uphold Seneca's commitment to Unconditional Care?

job_title: Wraparound Clinician in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Great clinical training and supervision hours for MFT Interns or ASW; lots of training opportunities free for employees; helpful colleagues and management; great benefits and paid time off
cons: This work is extremely stressful and overwhelming; unbelievably long hours, including employees working overtime and weekend hours completing documents; they give everyone a cell phone; large amount of documents to complete on time; high turnover rate; counselors and clinicians carry a crisis phone on a weekly basis that includes all hours, including weekends, for little pay; high expectations which are difficult to meet.

review_title: Rewarding work with a culture of kindness and support
pros:
Everybody I interact with on a daily basis is so kind and supportive. As one of my colleagues said, "teamwork makes the dream work" and that couldn't be more evident at Seneca. The work is so meaningful which is such a big motivator. 

Seneca treats their employees very well -- not only regarding compensation, benefits, time off, etc., but with a general sense of respect and appreciation. Such a wonderful atmosphere, wonderful people, and rewarding work.
cons: No complaints! No job is perfect, but working for Seneca gets pretty close.

pros: Seneca is such a supportive place to work. Having now worked in multiple programs in the agency, I can say that across the board there is a strong sense of community and shared values with supervisors supporting their staff to grow professionally and develop new skills. It is wonderful to work with such a talented group of people who are all passionate about the work they do and the children and families they help every day.
cons: The agency is constantly growing, which means there can be frequent changes and occasional growing pains.

pros: I had great coworkers, and got to work with some really amazing kids. Seneca provides good training opportunities on a variety of different topics and also provides a lot of support for career and educational advancement.
cons: There is high burnout and staff turnover. Classrooms tend to be understaffed, and I often felt very overworked without always receiving a lot of support form program administrators.

pros:
It's wonderful to be a part of the cutting edge of special education practice, leading the intersection between education and mental health and fostering more equitable educational opportunities for students who are typically marginalized!

It is a face-paced environment filled with talented and passionate people!
cons: Being innovative and responsive comes with challenges - it means moving fast and adapting quickly.  It brings a level of excitement, but is not for everyone!

job_title: Family Support Counselor in Oakland, CA
pros:
-Amazing co-workers.
-A lot of opportunities to learn a variety of skills.
-Opportunities to take on projects individually and in groups.
-Met great kids, families, and community members.
-Learned a lot about mental health and social justice issues.
-Great philosophy.
cons:
-Pay is too low.
-Extremely high turnover.
-Staff are pressured to meet billing percentages and work extra hours without pay to meet these.
-Weekend day work required.
-Very stressful and physically  (get ready for 1-4 hours of driving everyday) and mentally (pressure)
-Not enough response from management on individual concerns.

job_title: Residential Counselor in San Francisco, CA
pros: If you have a passion for working with children and teens, more specifically, those who are SED then Seneca is a great place.  There is a great level of support put in place to ensure the emotional well-being of the employees
cons: The types of interventions used on the teens can be rough for anyone new to the group home field.  Be prepared to receive blows (both physical and verbal) from the teens.

pros: I love Seneca’s vision, mission, and that they are willing to go above and beyond to support vulnerable youth and families. I also really loved the people I worked with and the access to trainings, support towards licensure, and my autonomy within my position.  $5,000 bump if you are bilingual and pass their language test.
cons: I found being a community-based clinician to be quite isolating. I also learned I did not want to work with little kids. The pay was not enough for me to be able to afford living in SF.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Seneca is doing incredible work in the community. They offer comprehensive services to clients and families. The staff enjoy coming to work and care about each other. I learned a lot from this agency about mental health, how nonprofits work, and who I am as a person, professionally and personally.
cons: As an administrative staff, I would occasionally feel overlooked by management and direct care staff.  There was less growth opportunities for me which led to me leaving the agency.

job_title: Wraparound Support Counselor in Santa Clara, CA
pros: Wraparound service providers work within a team structure providing a wide range of clinical insight into each case. There is a lot of collaboration with the county child services, juvenile justice systems, schools, group homes and shelters so staff gain a significant amount of knowledge in multiple social work domains. Good PTO time and schedule flexibility.
cons: 24 hour on call shifts 3 times a month (almost once a week) which can bleed over into your weekends. It is difficult to obtain good supervision.

pros: Seneca Family of Agencies provides exceptional services to kids in need. I work in a school program and have watched many, many youths benefit from the services offered. There are also excellent opportunities for professional development amongst staff, and there is a culture of appreciation and support which makes it a great place to work. Definitely a great organization!
cons: Working in direct care with clients can be emotionally and physically exhausting. There are many systems of support built in for staff, but nevertheless it can still be very hard work!

pros: I have been working in the Wraparound program for only a few months and am in love with my job and the people I work with! There is an amazing amount of support provided by coworkers and supervisors. There is also an emphasis on growth, personal and professional, that shows the agency genuinely cares about it's employees. The agency is also constantly providing many beneficial training opportunities. I cannot say enough good things about Seneca!
cons: I do not have any complaints about Seneca!

job_title: TBS Clinician in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Co-workers were friendly.
Milage compensation was fair.
cons:
Middle and upper level management prioritize billing over quality of care.
Middle and upper level management are usually not licensed clinicians.
Poor work-life balance.
Rapid turn-over because of burn out.

job_title: Program Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great benefits, nice co-workers. Feel like you are working on genuinely improving the lives of the youth serves. Comprehensive training plans with CPR certification. Great place to get your foot in the door with a non-profit. CEO makes it a point to meet all new hires.
cons: Too much turn over especially with management. Lower level staff also get burnt out quickly which makes things chaotic when they eventually leave

review_title: Thoughtful and caring organization for staff, children and their families
pros: The agency is responsive to the needs of their kids, families and staff. They have a very individualized approach for each person. Training and professional development was a huge focus for the agency and a lot of resources were allocated to ensure staff grew professionally and personally.  They strive to be a leader for the larger field in this area, as in others.
cons: It is a large organization that is figuring out how to meet different needs across two states.

job_title: Support Counselor in Marin City, CA
pros: Seneca family of Agencies values their employees. They strive to only hire the best. My coworkers are smart and motivated.
cons: Work/life balance is difficult. You work long hours and the paper work never ends. It feels that sometimes, management treats employees as disposable. Stress on the job is high and it's hard to meet expectations. High turnover rate.

review_title: Making a difference in Washington State
pros: Seneca offers a chance to work with truly dedicated individuals to change the way children dealing with abuse, neglect or other traumatic experiences can excel in school. It's truly a team approach and seneca stops at nothing to take care of the children it serves.
cons: This is very difficult work and its still truly new in Washington. It takes a lot of patience and a bit of faith!

pros: Seneca is a growing agency that is doing great things for the community and the families they serve. Seneca is an innovative company and welcomes employee input. Seneca really values their employees as well as their clients and spends a great deal of effort ensuring that employees feel supported.
cons: The nature of the work can be really emotionally challenging. It's easy to burn out in this field, despite Seneca's efforts to encourage self-care.

job_title: Family Support Counselor in Petaluma, CA
pros:
-Amazing staff
-Quality work helping those in need
-Flexible schedule
-Allowed to travel throughout the community
-Room for growth offered
cons:
-Low pay
-Must use personal vehicle to complete work, adding wear and tear
-Forced to work one weekend day
-May have to work early mornings or late evenings
-Traveling can be extensive
-Mental health notes can be demanding
-Work can be mentally and emotionally demanding

job_title: Wraparound Counselor, Program Assistant, Visitation Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Excellent training program, amazing transition from university to the working world. I felt supported by my supervisor and fellow staff members. Great place to work if you are looking for community within the workplace. Excellent benefits and PTO.
cons: Pay is low, which is to be expected for a non-profit if you don't have a graduate degree like myself.

review_title: I found my work family here at Seneca Family of Agencies!
pros: At Seneca you will work alongside bright and compassionate people. The support I received came from not only my supervisor, but also my peers. Office culture is dependent on your office/program, but no matter what program you land in, you can expect to find Seneca employees to be smart, caring and kind individuals.
cons: None. I love my amazing coworkers, flexible schedule, room to grow and the strong learning environment Seneca creates for their staff.

job_title: Mental Health Associate in Oakland, CA
pros: Rewarding/impactful career and a supportive team culture. The youth and families we work with are incredible. In my experience in the intensive treatment foster care program, staff form close and collaborative relationships with foster parents and biological families... which makes the work feel more successful and sustainable.
cons: Can be emotionally draining and difficult to balance direct care work with documentation expectations.

review_title: Physically and emotionally demanding job, but the culture makes the place special
pros: The culture, staff and training are exceptional. My co-workers felt like a big family. I am still friends with the people I worked with.
cons: Hard to promote. Pay is subpar. No retirement plan. Direct care staff are easy to replace, so eventually staff end up leaving if they don't get promoted or considered for future positions.

job_title: Outpatient Therapist in San Jose, CA
pros:
- The opportunity to work with such a rich and wide range of populations and demographics.
- Great work culture with amazing like-minded staff!
- Management (and upper management) team are always available and very supportive!
- Management are always open to feedback and looking to improve staff experience!
- Flexible work schedule.
cons:
- Although the work schedule is flexible, at times hours of work can be long.
- Heavy amounts of documentation and paperwork.
- Medi-Cal deadlines and expectations take time to adjust to.

pros:
Good Benefits
Consistant Supervision
Staff who are in it for the right reasons
Will build your knowledge of trauma informed care 
In house training department
Good pay for the level of work
cons:
Not enough hours in the day to complete your work
Not enough support in coaching or counseling out staff who are not a good fit for the organization
Culture varies from site to site 
Challenging to work amongst other leaders with no outside experience
Promote from within too often, even when people are not ready for leadership

pros: The benefits are incredible - 4 weeks paid vacation, full healthcare, and annual opportunities for pay increases.
cons: Working in one of our smaller offices can be challenging - it doesn't always feel like we can be a part of events or reach for opportunities that are held by the Bay Area programs.

review_title: Mission/Vision driven but behind the times w/ current employee and community needs
pros: great community and coworkers, strong mission, works hard to help children and families
cons: Not up to date with newest and best therapeutic practices; lots of employees with vicarious trauma and community/systemic agency care is not being addressed; lots of turn over

pros: AMAZING coworkers, really strong values of the agency, which are always the backbone of decisions made. Very generous with PTO. Four weeks per year! Supervisors really value you taking time for yourself.
cons: Really hard work. Often as a Support Counselor, you work 9-10 hour days at least several days per week. On-Call shifts are really challenging. Lots of turnover.

pros: Kinship Center Seneca Family of Agencies is definitely family oriented. Even when working with each other. We look out for each other and try to find ways to help us not only do our jobs but take care of our own individual families as well.
cons: It's a large organization with a lot of moving parts. Due to mergers it can get confusing at times keeping up with all the changes. But with communication it eventually comes together.

pros: This agency creates an amazing support system for its staff, as well as unique opportunities for advancement and growth. The values each of the staff hold show just how dedicated the employees are to helping children and families.
cons: It's sometimes hard to separate work and life. Even though Seneca staff are supportive, we strive to be the best and the job can be demanding at times.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: very supportive environment with very talented staff who actually care about the population of clients that they serve.
cons: overworked at times, and under appreciated for going above and beyond.  At times, I feel as though it is an expectation to work more hours, and dow more work than assigned.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Fremont, CA
pros: Great training opportunities, scholarships available, supportive work environment, cultural competency trainings available often, feel coworkers support and always "have your back"
cons: Pay, benefits, ability to move up in agency.  It seems like they prefer to have only entry level staff. Young and don't know better so they stay at the agency.

review_title: Great for clients, bad for workers
pros: The clinicians and counselors I worked with were amazing people that truly cared about making impacts on the lives of our clients. You couldn't ask for better co-workers.
cons: Management. Many big changes happened without a lot of support. INCREDIBLY HIGH TURNOVER RATE. 24 people left the office in a span of 2 years...(it wasn't a big office to begin with).

review_title: Meaningful, full filling, but very very hard
job_title: Family Support Counselor in San Francisco, CA
pros: Coworkers are great, very supportive directors, supervisors of color are helpful and vital in the success of other pocs
cons: High turnover, desperation has led to hiring certain people that are not equipped for the their positions including some in managerial roles, low pay , use of personal car, rapid response shifts

review_title: Great place to work towards licensure. Horrific management after that.
pros: Great PTO for clinicians. Used to have amazing clinical supervision but then cut costs.
cons: They encourage you to speak up but they are insular. There are favored people who should be reviewed and held to the same standards as those below them.

pros: Seneca not only strives to support individual children and their families but also focuses on the well-being of their staff by providing a supportive work environment, a unique benefits plan that supports the work-life balance, and encourages continued educational and professional growth.
cons: There is often a lot of driving involved to best meet the needs of all of the clients and families and school partnerships that need support.

pros: This place is a great place to work. Employees make it happen as you are working with a challenging population
cons: you know it's not the best  facility, but if you are going to work here you know what you are gettign intol

pros: There is a lot of freedom to propose new ideas and express creativity. The management team is very supportive and encourages personal growth.
cons: As with all non-profits, you are going to have to do a lot of multi-tasking. If your are not an adaptable person, this might not be the best fit for you. I personally love it and find it adds a lot to my career growth.

pros: Great place to learn, grow, and be challenged as a clinician. I have loved being able to work as a supportive team.
cons: The youth and families you will work with have many significant needs that can be challenging, and at times, overwhelming.

review_title: Excellent Mental Health Agency To Work For
job_title: Community Based Worker in Oakland, CA
pros:
SFA offers employees a multitude of environments to work and learn (educational settings, community based settings, non-public school settings). 
SFA provides ongoing agency-directed and non agency-directed training to all employees
SFA provides employees ongoing educational opportunities to further their professional growth
cons: The work (physical and mental) will challenge employees to establish and sustain boundaries related to not taking the work home with you

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Hayward, CA
pros: Supportive staff/supervisors, loyalty to staff and you can work in multiple departments. Possibilities are endless in terms of growth and they're very loyal! Once you're in you're in! Lots of team building and building of company morale.
cons: Emotionally draining as with most social work occupations. Many positions require you to travel a lot so having reliable transportation is ideal.

pros:
-privilege to work with families going through their roughest times
- having an impact 
- getting supervision
